intro: Zollikoferia secunda, commonly known as the Mexican giant dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its large, yellow composite flowers and broad, heart-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, similar to other members of the Asteraceae family. Zollikoferia secunda is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
